article.headline: Elon 79, Wofford 69
article.story: ELON, N.C. (AP) -- Brett James scored 22 points and went 4-for-5 from 3-point range to help Elon past Wofford 79-69 on Wednesday. Devan Carter added 19 points, Chris Chalko had 11 and LeVonn Jordan finished with 10 for The Phoenix (2-7), who led 33-32 at the break. Elon never trailed, shooting 47.5 percent from the field and holding Wofford to 38.6 percent shooting. Both teams grabbed 39 rebounds, but Elon was able to score 17 second-chance points to Wofford's seven. The Phoenix led by as much as 16 with 3:46 left in the second half. Shane Nichols led the Terriers (4-8) with 18 points and Eric Marshall added 17 points. Nichols and Marshall each made 3-of-5 3-pointers. Drew Gibson added 10 points and Matt Estep had nine.
